node.title: China officials attempt to soothe fears after issuing notice urging families stockpile necessities
node.alt: Fruit at a market in China
node.description: Chinese officials are back-pedalling from original notices they issued alerting families to stockpile daily necessities such as vegetables and rice, in case of emergencies, after panic spread on social media.
node.content:
["Chinese\u00a0officials are back-pedalling\u00a0from their original\u00a0notices they issued alerting\u00a0families to stockpile daily necessities such\u00a0as vegetables and rice, in case of emergencies, after panic spread on social media.\u00a0", "A warning from the Commerce Ministry posted late on Monday, local time,\u00a0comes\u00a0after COVID-19 outbreaks and heavy rain had\u00a0caused\u00a0concerns over\u00a0vegetable shortage supplies.", "The notice warned\u00a0local authorities to\u00a0buy vegetables that can be stored well in advance and also strengthen emergency delivery networks.", "Shortly after the warning\u00a0was posted, it\u00a0stirred\u00a0concern on\u00a0Chinese social media that it may\u00a0have been triggered by heightened tensions with Taiwan.", "In response,\u00a0Chinese officials released statements\u00a0that\u00a0the notices were part of regular government efforts to help residents prepare for potential emergencies.", "Head of the Ministry's department of market operation and consumption promotion, Zhu Xiaoliang, said that the notice was intended to ensure stable supplies and prices of food for residents through various measures, including guiding firms in signing supply contracts, according to the Global Times.\u00a0", "\"Judging from the current situation, the supply of daily necessities in various places is sufficient and should be fully guaranteed,\" Mr Zhu said.", "Deputy head of the circulation and consumption institute under the ministry,\u00a0Guan Lixin, said the\u00a0notice was \"issued based on the frequent natural disasters\" which he said\u00a0caused soaring vegetable prices as well as\u00a0sporadic COVID-19\u00a0cases.", "\"[The notice]\u00a0was arranged in advance. The aim is to better safeguard people's daily necessities during this winter and next spring,\" Mr Guan said.", "However, the\u00a0notice went\u00a0viral on social platforms shortly after posting.", "Some people said they were rushing to stock up on rice, cooking oil\u00a0and salt.", "\"As soon as this news came out, all the old people near me went crazy, panic-buying in the supermarket,\" wrote one user on China social media platform Weibo.", "Local media has also recently published lists of recommended goods to store at home, including biscuits and instant noodles, vitamins, radios\u00a0and flashlights.", "The public response forced state media\u00a0to try to soothe fears and clarify the ministry's statement.", "A\u00a0Communist Party-backed newspaper,\u00a0 The Economic Daily, told social media users\u00a0not to have \"too much of an overactive imagination\" and that the directive's purpose was to make sure citizens were not caught off-guard if there was a lockdown in their area.", "The ministry's statement\u00a0urged local authorities to do a good job in ensuring supply and stable prices and to give early warnings of any supply problems.", "
Extreme weather influences
", "", "
Extreme weather in early October destroyed crops\u00a0as outbreaks threaten to disrupt food supplies.(Reuters: Thomas Peter)
", "The government typically makes extra efforts to boost fresh vegetable and pork supplies before China's most important holiday, Lunar New Year, which in 2022 falls in early February.", "However, this year those efforts have become more urgent after extreme weather in early October destroyed crops in Shandong \u2014 the country's biggest vegetable growing region \u2014 and as outbreaks of COVID-19 cases stretching from the north-west to the north-east of the country threaten to disrupt food supplies.", "Last week, prices of cucumbers, spinach and broccoli had more than doubled from early October.\u00a0", "Although prices have eased in recent days, economists expect a significant year-on-year increase in consumer price inflation for October, the first in five months.", "The pandemic has brought an increased focus on food security, with the government drafting a food security law and outlining new efforts to curb food waste.", "ABC/Reuters"]
